speaker: JARED CHIRP
line: Holy Ghost, come to me. Praise God. Praise God. Move up on me, Holy Ghost. Praise God.

speaker: JARED CHIRP
line: This here sinner repents. Holy Ghost, move up on me.

speaker: JARED CHIRP
line: Protect me and mine with your quickening power.

speaker: JARED CHIRP
line: Holy Ghost, come to me.

speaker: JARED CHIRP
line: Oh, help me, Jesus! Oh, help me, Jesus! Help me, Jesus!

speaker: MULDER
line: Not as far as you know?... Not this time of year?... All right. Thank you, Doctor. Good-bye.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Snakes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Lots and lots of snakes. Very pissed off ones, from the look of it.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's the former Mr. Jared Chirp of McMinn County, Tennessee.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my God.

speaker: MULDER
line: 116 separate bite marks. Judging from the wound measurements there were 50 different snakes involved-- mostly copperheads and rattlers.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But it says here that he was found dead in his car.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, with a pistol in his hand. He fired six shots, into the floorboards, into the passenger seat, even into his own right kneecap, and the windows were shut and the doors were locked.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But, uh, what happened to all the snakes?

speaker: MULDER
line: No one seems to know that. There was not a scale found. I just got off the phone with a herpetologist at the Smithsonian, and he's stumped - especially because these rattlesnakes tend to hibernate in winter.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you think that, uh... Mr. Chirp was murdered?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, it certainly would appear that way but the question is "how?" There's no physical evidence at all-- no tire tracks, no footprints. I can't see how anyone could have accomplished this. And then you got to ask yourself "why?" Why would anybody use poisonous snakes as a murder weapon?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe it's symbolic. I mean, serpents and religion have gone hand in hand. They've represented the temptation of Eve-- Original Sin. They've been feared and hated throughout history as they've been thought to embody Satan-- to serve Evil itself.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe these ones actually do.

speaker: SCULLY
line: These particular serpents actually were serving Evil? Are you going to type that on our travel request?

speaker: MULDER
line: Mmm... No. But at the very least this case does seem to center around religion... and you're not the only one to think that by the way.

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: Jared is in a better place now, Gracie. He's at peace.

speaker: IRIS FINSTER
line: You know, Reverend Mackey's right, honey. He is in a better place.

speaker: MULDER
line: Reverend Samuel Mackey? My name is Fox Mulder. This is Dana Scully. We're with the FBI. May be speak with you, sir?

speaker: IRIS FINSTER
line: Come on, Gracie. Let's get you home.

speaker: MULDER
line: We apologize for our timing. We'd like to ask you a few questions about Jared Chirp.

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: I've already spoken to the Sheriff about it... though I'm not sure that was a good idea.

speaker: MULDER
line: Specifically, you had suspicions about the manner in which he died?

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: I should be the last one to point a finger or say a harsh word. Our church is founded on acceptance and tolerance of all people, all beliefs...

speaker: SCULLY
line: But...?

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: Before Jared joined us he belonged to a fundamentalist congregation outside of town-- the Church of God with Signs and Wonders. It practices snake handling.

speaker: MULDER
line: As a sign of faith, worshipers handle deadly snakes or drink poison.

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: They believe that the Holy Spirit protects the righteous. Jared grew up in that church but it is very difficult to walk away from a belief system that one is raised in. It takes great courage.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why did he walk away?

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: He and Gracie, his girlfriend, left it together. They found that a rigid interpretation of the Bible was not for them, especially when it involves risking life and limb in the act of worship, but again it is not for me to judge. I will say, however, that both Jared and Gracie were persecuted by the members of their former church. All this animus... stems from their church leader-- Enoch O'Connor.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Animus enough to motivate a murder?

speaker: "LOOK UNTO ME AND BE SAVED
line: ALL THE ENDS OF THE EARTH;

speaker: FOR I AM GOD, AND THERE IS NONE OTHER
line: nan

speaker: ISAIAH 45
line: 22" All the windows are shaded. MULDER and SCULLY walk up the steps onto the porch.)

speaker: SCULLY
line: Snake handling. I didn't learn that in catechism class.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's funny. I knew a couple of Catholic schoolgirls who were expert at it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Enoch O'Connor? Federal Agents. Where's the light switch?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The nearest one? Probably ten miles from here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Rattlesnakes and medieval visions of damnation. Well, I for one, feel a whole lot closer to God.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know, Scully. When you... when you get right down to it is snake handling any harder to buy into than communion wafers or transubstantiation...?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Or believing in flying saucers, for that matter.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm just saying that-that your faith and O'Connor's seem to be based on the same book.

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh-oh, Scully. What do you think O'Connor keeps in here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Something slithery?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's all right. It's empty.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why is it empty?

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: By what right are you here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Reverend Enoch O'Connor, we're Federal Agents. We're, uh... with the FBI.

speaker: MULDER
line: Reverend, do something about these snakes, please.

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: You got nothing to fear if you're righteous people.

speaker: MULDER
line: Just in case we're not, we could use a little righteous help here.

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: What do you want?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We're here to ask you questions about a former member of your church-- Jared Chirp.

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: That boy strayed from the path and was lost to the dark one. I'm sorry for his soul. There ain't much else to say.

speaker: MULDER
line: He died from multiple snakebites. We thought maybe you'd have a special insight into that.

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: I do. It was a test.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A test? What do you mean?

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: A test of faith. A test of righteousness. When the Devil aims to test you, you'd best be ready and you sure better know which side you're on.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you speaking about the Devil's test or your test?

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: I don't think you people realize which side you're on. I do. You can leave now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Tennessee. Snakes. Thank you, Mulder. Thank you so much. I say we arrest him and catch the first flight out of here.

speaker: MULDER
line: He does seem like a likely suspect only the local sheriff's office ruled him out. Apparently, he was in Kentucky the night Jared Chirp died.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, Mulder, there are other people in his congregation.

speaker: MULDER
line: Jared Chirp died with a packed suitcase by his side. There's got to be somebody that knows where he was headed.

speaker: IRIS FINSTER
line: Here you go, honey.

speaker: IRIS FINSTER
line: Reverend Mackey? This might not be the best time but can I speak to you?

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: Of course.

speaker: IRIS FINSTER
line: Jared called the boardinghouse late the night he died. sound asleep and it sounded to me like the boy had been drinking. He just wasn't making any sense. He was ranting about seeing the Devil and paying for his sins.

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: Iris, why didn't you tell the police?

speaker: IRIS FINSTER
line: Well, I don't know how to tell Gracie. I kept her from speaking to Jared his last night on Earth. I couldn't have known, though. I couldn't have...

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: No, no. You couldn't have known. I can help you talk to Gracie.

speaker: GRACIE
line: Reverend Mackey? Everybody's here.

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: Thank you, Gracie. You and I will see this through, Iris, right after study group.

speaker: IRIS FINSTER
line: Thank you.

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: Our God is a fearsome God.

speaker: MAN
line: Amen!

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: He demands our very lives!

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: Revelations Three, the 16th verse. "'Tis better to be hot or cold than lukewarm."

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: God says, if you're lukewarm He will vomit you out of His mouth.

speaker: CONGREGATION
line: Praise God!

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: Yes! Did you hear what I said?!

speaker: CONGREGATION
line: Praise God! Yes!

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: God hates the lukewarm!

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: "So, because you are lukewarm I am about to spit you out of my mouth." Now, that could sound pretty harsh, couldn't it? I mean, depending on how one reads it. But if we put this verse in a historical context I think we'll see that John was specifically addressing the problems of the Church at Laodicea.

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: God wants you hot! God wants you on fire!

speaker: MAN
line: Praise Jesus.

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: God wants you to put your money where your mouth is!

speaker: CONGREGATION
line: Amen! Hallelujah! Praise Jesus! Praise the Lord!

speaker: CONGREGATION
line: Amen! Yes, amen!

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: People ask me why I handle snakes.

speaker: CONGREGATION
line: Praise the lord! Hallelujah!

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: I tell 'em it's 'cause the scripture tells me to.

speaker: CONGREGATION
line: Praise God!

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: ...he offers to Jesus to come into our lives and dine with us if only we'd open the door.

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR AND CONGREGATION
line: Praise God! Hallelujah! Praise God! Hallelujah!

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: ...the manner in which John ends this chapter. His emphasis is on teaching the Church at Laodicea perseverance. He uses the word "overcome" not once, but twice. I think he's also trying to...

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: Witness the power! Witness the awesome power of God as He blesses His people and destroys His enemies! Thank you, God!

speaker: CUTS TO
line: nan

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: I don't understand it. None of us saw or heard anything. Just her scream. When we ran in, she was lying on the floor. I cleared everybody out of the building once I saw the bite marks, but...

speaker: MULDER
line: Reverend, how close was Iris to Jared Chirp?

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: Not... particularly close but I'd spoken with her not 15 minutes earlier about him.

speaker: MULDER
line: What'd you talk about?

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: She was upset. Something about Jared calling her the night he died looking for Gracie. Something about him... paying for his sins. Well, I don't know. We didn't get to finish our conversation.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe that was the point.

speaker: GRACIE
line: Why Iris? Why is this happening?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Gracie we're investigating the leader of your former church, Enoch O'Connor. We believe that he may have had something to do with what happened here tonight.

speaker: MULDER
line: We would appreciate anything you could tell us about him.

speaker: GRACIE
line: No, he didn't do this. No. He didn't do this. This... this is Satan's work, not man's.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Gracie, that sounds like something that Reverend O'Connor might say. Now, you're not a member of that congregation anymore. And I understand that's because you're someone who thinks for herself.

speaker: MULDER
line: Keeping an open mind, Gracie, is it conceivable that O'Connor could have done any of this?

speaker: GRACIE
line: No! Don't you think I would know, me, of all people? He couldn't have done this. He just cou....

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: Gracie might be biased.

speaker: MULDER
line: O'Connor is your father.

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: When Gracie got pregnant...

speaker: MULDER
line: O'Connor barred her from his church. She and Jared Chirp.

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: His church and his home.

speaker: MULDER
line: You coming?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think I'll check around back.

speaker: MULDER
line: "Pray for the souls... lost to us."

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh!!

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: You must be judged.

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: Repent! Pray for the Lord's quickening power. Into the hands of God.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let her go!

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: Your FBI partner could've learned something about herself if you hadn't stopped me. Some powerful good news, maybe.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'd say it's good news for you that she's not here right now... considering what you tried to do to her. Is that what you did to your wife?

speaker: MULDER
line: Alice O'Connor... succumbed to multiple snakebites in June, 1994. It happened during a church service or at least that's what you told local police. You got away with it... almost. What was, uh... the problem with your wife? Was she not... righteous enough for you? Just like your daughter's boyfriend... or Iris Finster?

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: Educated man... too smart to know any better.

speaker: MULDER
line: Smart enough to know you're a murderer.

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: Satan is near, and you don't even have eyes. You're just proud and fancy free.

speaker: MULDER
line: No one quite passes muster with you, huh? You feel the need to exact some kind of Old Testament revenge? What about your daughter? What were your plans for her?

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: I pray for her soul. I pray and I pray because she's lost.

speaker: MULDER
line: Because she no longer believes as you do?

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: You think because you're educated you're better than most? You ain't. Unless you're smart down here the Devil's going to make a fool of you and you ain't even going to know it.

speaker: GRACIE
line: I changed my mind. I don't... I don't want to see him. Besides, I won't do any better than you people in getting him to talk.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Gracie. You still don't believe your father did it?

speaker: GRACIE
line: It don't matter what I believe. He'll be judged as he deserves. Can't nobody avoid it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Deputy found him about an hour ago. There's no telling when he was attacked.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I guess it's looking less and less like he's a suspect.

speaker: MULDER
line: Unless he somehow managed to do this to himself...... as a test of his own righteousness.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, if so, Mulder, the jury's still out. I just spoke to his doctors. It's a toss-up as to whether he's going to pull through this.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about antivenin treatment?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's not receiving it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why not?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Gracie stepped in. She's trying to forbid treatment on religious grounds. It's not clear whether she has a legal claim to do it, but she says that it's up to God as to whether he lives or dies.

speaker: MULDER
line: And you're thinking that her actions may not be entirely motivated by concern for her father's eternal soul?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, more to the point, Mulder, what if she did this? She told me that her father would be judged as he deserves.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you think this is what she meant?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, she grew up around snakes, Mulder. Who's to say she isn't every bit as adept at handling them as he is?

speaker: MULDER
line: I can see her being angry enough at her father to attack him, but... what about the others?

speaker: MULDER
line: He left in a hurry. Packed one suitcase and a gun. Earlier that night he calls Gracie. Gets Iris instead. Starts rambling about paying for his sins. He's frightened... wants to leave town, presumably with Gracie.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, what's he scared of?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Though I don't understand it, O'Connor's church exerts a strong pull on these people.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's not so hard to understand. It's a culture with a very well-defined set of rules.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's an intolerant culture, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know, Scully. Sometimes a little intolerance can be a welcome thing. Clear-cut right and wrong, black and white, no shades of gray. You know, in a society where hard and fast rules are harder and harder to come by, I think some people would appreciate that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're saying that you, Fox Mulder, would welcome someone telling you what to believe?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm just saying that somebody offering you all the answers... could be a very powerful thing.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, it's lab results. Am I reading this right? That Jared Chirp had himself tested for sterility? "Patient is infertile due to insufficient... No medical recommendation to... Condition considered permanent.")

speaker: SCULLY
line: Which turns out to be more or less the case. Based on this, that means that Jared can't be the father of Gracie's baby.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's dated the day he died.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So maybe he was killed because he discovered the truth.

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: Gracie, I'd like to ask you to reconsider.

speaker: GRACIE
line: No. This is what he'd want.

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: He may die without medical treatment.

speaker: GRACIE
line: I've seen him bit a dozen times. He always said that it was up to God whether he lives or dies. Said it was a worse sin not to trust God.

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: There are many ways to trust God, Gracie. One of them is to trust in the miracles of doctors and medicine. Or... in your heart do you really not want him to get better?

speaker: GRACIE
line: It ain't for me. I can't risk his soul.

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: And when you first came to me you said that you wanted to think for yourself. To live your life as you saw fit. If you stand here and let your father die, whose beliefs are you living? Yours? Or his?

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: You're doing the right thing. I'll go tell the doctor, okay?

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: Agents, Enoch O'Connor is gone. I was away for five minutes. His bed's empty. Gracie is gone, too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How could Gracie have possibly gotten him out of here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe he took her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, he was on his deathbed; that's impossible. And besides, what's his motivation?

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: I may be able to answer that. Jared Chirp wasn't the father of Gracie's child.

speaker: MULDER
line: We know that. What about it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Enoch O'Connor is.

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: That's why she wanted to get away from him and his church as fast as she could. And I tried to teach her to forgive him.

speaker: GRACIE
line: Daddy, please...!

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: I'm bringing you home.

speaker: GRACIE
line: Somebody help me!

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: In the name of our Holy and most fearsome God...

speaker: CONGREGATION
line: Hallelujah!

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: Resist the devil and he will flee. Resist him!

speaker: GRACIE
line: Something's wrong... Something's wrong with my baby. Oh!

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: Jesus, put your hands on this one. You can heal her. Oh, yes, God is... Yes... Jesus...

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: Oh, Lord... Jesus. Dear Lord... Jesus, deliver this woman. Jesus, Jesus...

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: Yes, Lord. Yes, Jesus. Oh, yes. Jesus. Jesus.

speaker: GRACIE
line: Oh, no! Don't, don't!

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: Dear God, dear heavenly Father, deliver this woman. Jesus.

speaker: GRACIE
line: No, please...

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: Lay your hands on this woman. God! Yes!

speaker: GRACIE
line: No... Don't! Don't!

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: Hallelujah, praise the lord!

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: Oh, my God. Oh, my God.

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: Dear Jesus. Dear Jesus! Hallelujah! Hallelujah! Dear Jesus! Hallelujah! Hallelujah

speaker: SCULLY
line: How is she?

speaker: EMT
line: Deep shock. Some loss of blood.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened here? Where's the baby?

speaker: COP
line: These folks aren't talking.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully. Take a look at this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Snakes. She gave birth to snakes.

speaker: WOMAN
line: The devil has been cast out.

speaker: MULDER
line: Stay with her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are you going?

speaker: MULDER
line: To find her father. He's going to want to tie up some loose ends.

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: You stole what was most precious to me.

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: Gracie? She came to me on her own. She wanted to escape a life of fear and judgment. Of intolerance.

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: She fled a harsh and vengeful God. And you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Drop the knife!

speaker: MULDER
line: You all right?

speaker: GRACIE
line: Daddy. Daddy?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Gracie, it's Agent Scully. We're taking you to the doctor right now, okay?

speaker: GRACIE
line: No. I... got to...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can you tell me what happened, Gracie?

speaker: GRACIE
line: Where's my Daddy?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're safe, Gracie. My partner's gone after him. Gracie, you're going to be okay. He can't hurt you anymore.

speaker: GRACIE
line: You don't understand. He saved me.

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: I'll call for an ambulance.

speaker: MULDER
line: Relax. Help's on the way.

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: No, it's not. I told you, boy. You still don't know which side you're on. Be smart down here.

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: Yes, please hurry. They're on their way.

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: Agent.

speaker: MULDER
line: It wasn't O'Connor. It was you. You killed Jared Chirp.

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: You're joking.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I'm just beginning to see it now. Jared must have come to understand that he wasn't the father of Gracie's baby... that you were. Did he confront you earlier that night only to see you for who you really are?

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: Just who is it you think I am?

speaker: MULDER
line: Is that what happened with Iris Finster? Was she beginning to catch on? Is that why you killed her? Or was it just to further frame Enoch O'Connor? Is that what this is really about? Ruining O'Connor? Seducing his daughter? Destroying him by any conceivable means?

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: Are you a righteous man, Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Stay where you are.

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: It's just a simple question. Most people believe they're on the side of angels. But are they?

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: If you were put to the test... how would you do?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where's Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Help!

speaker: REVEREND O'CONNOR
line: You can't help him. This is his alone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?!

speaker: MULDER
line: Mackey?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Still no trace... even though every law enforcement agency in Tennessee's out looking for him.

speaker: MULDER
line: They won't find him. People think the devil has horns and a tail. They're not used to looking for some kindly man who tells you what you want to hear.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's just a man, Mulder. Just like O'Connor.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not like O'Connor. If this was some kind of test looks like I failed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'd say if it was, you passed with flying colors. You're alive, aren't you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Proud and fancy-free.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Reverend Wells, it's a real joy to have a man in the pulpit who has such an open and modern way of looking at God.

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: Bless you for saying so.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Well, I won't keep you. I just wanted to welcome you to Hamden.

speaker: REVEREND MACKEY
line: Thank you. I look forward to seeing you on Sunday.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Thank you.
